vectorData.altText: 20. Region A is supplied by the __________ ____________artery.
That is incorrect. Click here      to learn the answer, then come back to try again.
That’s right!  Penetrating branches of the posterior cerebral artery (PCA) supplies the forceps major, A, at the splenium of the corpus callosum.

You already learned something about the vascular territory of the posterior cerebral artery from following it around the midbrain, over the inferior surface of the cerebrum to the occipital pole.
In this section, we see that penetrating arteries of the PCA supply the thalamus and forceps major.
In your mind, include these structures in the PCA territory.
